fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4514].
  {panel}

It would be great if we could go directly to "Add Page in Space from Template". This would meet our workflow needs in one simple step. Currently it takes 4 steps, with room for error along the way.

Go to Add Page 
Click "select a template page" 
Select the correct template 
Click next

would be nice to streamline this.
fields.summary: Make it Simpler to Add Page from Template
Extend list of escapeable wiki markup characters to allow for escaping in rich text mode

fields.description:
When the {dynamictasklistmacro} is present in a page, formatting via the "Format" menu in the WYSIWYG editor doesn't work. Often the text will not change, or it will just disappear.

Steps to reproduce:

Add dynamictasklistmacro and text to page
Save page
Edit page again
Select text other than the macro
Go to "Format" menu and click on ANY of the pre-set formats
Bam! Watch it disappear (or do nothing)

The associated JavaScript error (an unhandled exception, actually) occurs in the "TinyMCE.prototype.createFormatNode" function in the zip_src servlet (line 2658). It seems the 2nd attribute for the element (index 1) returns "" as the name and void as the value. The cause is still the macro, though.
fields.summary: dynamictasklist macro in page causes formatting macros to not work

fields.description:
PermittedPagesSearch - makeProhibitedGroupPermissionsQuery(User user)

Loops through groups twice, each group which the user does not belong to is added to the the query (memory usage if many groups have been imported).

We need to perform the LuceneQuery without loading all groups. Charles has proposed that we build the exclusion list by consulting Lucene prior to the permission check. 

It all seems a little odd to me - we should be able to ask Lucene for content which is indexed for groupx alone.
fields.summary: SmartListManager performance degrades as the number of groups increases

However, some users take advantage of this, as security is not a huge issue for them. Rather than only sending trackback pings out for non-secure pages, there shold be 3 options for trackback:

1. All Pages
2. Public Only
3. Off

fields.description:
When trying to do a PDF-export of a subsection of a Space, the export fails.  It comes up with an index, that links to the selected sub-pages, but those pages don't exist (the PDF is 1 page, the index only).

For example, if the space contains:
* Home
** Foo
** Bar
** My Requirements
*** Page 1
*** Page 2

And if I select "My Requirements", "Page 1" and "Page 2", the PDF lists the 3 selected pages in the left-hand index and the front index page, but does not actually include the 3 pages (clicking the links in the PDF does nothing).  

The only way to get the pages included is to select the pages going up the hierarchy, all the way up to home (in this example, that would mean to simply select the parent page, which is Home).  If you do this, the PDF includes all selected pages, including the text of the "Home" page.

I want to export only a subtree of my data ("My Requirements" and below).  I don't want to include the Home page, as this contains temporary links, todo lists, etc.
fields.summary: PDF export of sub-tree fails

fields.description:
While investigating another bug, I noticed that the {code} element is not respecting the formatting of the element more than once.   If I add the following 

{code:xml}
<test>
    <another tag="attribute"/>
</test>
{code}

to a page I'm editing and select save then the formatting (i.e. indenting) is correctly displayed.  However, if I try and edit the page again then the formatting is gone and all the elements start in 1st column.
fields.summary: Formatting lost with {code} element

fields.description:
Groovy looks like a very interesting language, but the documentation is still rather sparse.  For example, this page:

http://groovy.codehaus.org/GroovyMarkup

discusses GroovyMarkup and builders, but leave the novice Groovy programmer with many questions.  For example, what is actually happening when a method call occurs?  What about reserved keywords?  Why do the closures not refer to the builder object, but just have method calls in them with no receiving object?

I had to sift through the source code and scan Google for answers.  Now I understand that the method call is getting intercepted by invokeMethod, and the receiving object isn't specified because of something involving setDelegate/getDelegate.  I also realize now that reserved keywords can be dealt with by prepending an underscore, and dashes in XML keywords also can be handled with underscores.  None of this is documented very clearly or cleanly --- it would really help if someone were to fill out these missing pieces.  The documentation tends to leave out a lot of detail --- it would be great if there were more complete information on some of these important features (like the meta-object protocol).

It would be great if the Closures documentation could at least mention (or somewhere discuss) the setDelegate/getDelegate functionality which would explain the curious syntax of Builder usage.
fields.summary: GroovyMarkup documentation could use info on the meta-object protocol, Closure/setDelegate, and reserved keywords

fields.description:
In re:

http://docs.codehaus.org/display/GROOVY/Groovyc+Ant+Task

There is a typo in this page. The taskdef should look like this:

<taskdef name="groovyc"
classname="org.codehaus.groovy.ant.Groovyc"
classpathref="my.classpath"/>

Took me several hours struggling with Ant before I noticed this typo!
fields.summary: Typo in Groovyc Ant Task documentation

fields.description:
If you name a plugin with capitalization in it (in the atlassian-plugin.xml), then the macro will never be found.

On the other hand, as long as it's lower case, any capitalization for calling it works: {myPlugin}, {myplugin}, etc.

I suspect, toLowerCase got called in one direction, but not the other.

This should _at the very least_ be documented in bright red letters on the How To Create Plugins documentation.
fields.summary: plugins cannot use capitalization in their names

fields.description:
I upgraded to 2.0RC1 this morning, loaded my backups and all seemed to be fine.  I started authoring a new page and all was still fine.  However, after I created a 2nd new page that was a child of the 1st new page, then whenever I try and edit a page (doesn't matter whether it is new or old), Confluence is constantly refreshing the page.  This behavior is not evident in IE 6.0.2900.2180.xpsp_sp2_gdr.050301-1519 (WTF kinda version # is that?!), nor was it evident with Confluence 1.4.4.

I have restarted firefox and deleted all cookies relate to the server that cnfluence is running on to no avail.  At this point my only solutions are to go back to confluence 1.4.4 or use IE for editing pages.
fields.summary: Confluence 2.0RC1 causes constant reloading in firefox 1.5 beta 2

fields.description:

|| Key || Value ||

| a | alpha |
| b | beta |
| |

This is no longer equivalent, as can be verified by switching back to rich text or preview...

fields.description:
If you click on the link, a "Not Permitted" page is displayed, when profile attachments are disabled for the user (even if you are trying to access it yourself). This is because the link is to the view attachments page for the user profile. If profile attachments are turned off, the permission manager determines that the user lacks permission to create attachments, and so returns not permitted for that URL call.

A fix might be to instead take the user to the "View Profile" page, which will show the profile picture.
fields.summary: Accessing user profile picture from Dashboard results in a "Not Permitted" page

fields.description:
Legacy RSS feeds (the ones that convert 1.4-vintage feed URLs to feed-builder backed feeds) are all without titles. This means, for example, that every single Confluence-backed RSS feed in javablogs.com is now called "Confluence RSS feed" when they used to be called things like "Javablogs News and Updates"

We need to fix this, as it's just going to get worse when more sites upgrade.

fields.description:
I posted an anonymous comment regarding the Toolkit - i.e. I was not logged in. The toggles for WIKI and WYSIWYG are probably closer to what I was expecting for JIRA. Anyway, I clicked on the button "Make Rich Text Default" and I got an error:
com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Trying to set a property on a null user this is not allowed
fields.summary: Error when setting default to rich text format

fields.summary: NPE Caught an Ognl exception while getting property users

fields.description:
If an edited page has links in them, and the user is in the "Preview" window of the wysiwyg editor, clicking the link replaces the editor window with the new target, as expected. 

However if the user has entered new text, it is now lost. Clicking the web browser "back" button returns only an empty editor, or whatever was there before the last edits. This is very user-unfriendly

The previous contents should be restored, or the link should open in a new window (which is probably the easiest fix).
fields.summary: data loss when clicking links in Preview window

fields.description: If you view another user's profile, the attachments tab does not show up (when it did before).
fields.summary: Profile attachments tab does not show up for other users

fields.description:
In the WYSIWYG Editor view, I select a line of text by clicking left of the line and then dragging down. I then press ctr-c to copy, and click at the leftmost position of another line. After pressing ctrl-v the copied line should be pasted in front of the existing text, but nothing happens.

It works if the copied text comes from some other place, such as a text editor though. It also works when the insertion mark is not in the leftmost position.
fields.summary: Paste fails at certain cursor positions

fields.description: See screenshot - this will be annoying for Linux users. They won't install the matching fonts.
fields.summary: linux unfriendly character used in WYIWYG editor

fields.description:
Upon the completion of restoring Confluence, the administrator is presented a blank (completely empty) page; it appears the restore failed.

Cause: If the administration account executing the restore is not a user in the "restored" version of Confluence, the administrator has no access to view the confluence page... so an empty page is displayed.

Work around: Clear browser cache (or open a different browser) and go to confluence again.  You should now see Confluence pages correctly (e.g. the login page).
fields.summary: Blank page after restore

fields.summary: Update confluence demo space to include labels.

fields.description:
Not sure if anyone has used the jspwiki utility recently and on recent builds of Confluence, but I'm unable to get a valid import from a JSPWiki export.

I've simplified things down to just attempting to export and import the test wiki that comes with the jspwiki-exporter source. I edited that jspwiki.properties file so that it was pointing the frontPage at the TextFormattingRules page, and had absolute paths to the base dir and attachment dir. Manual inspection of the entities showed that it had picked the pages up, but there was no home page for the space.

So, after exporting it and then importing it, there are lots of problems. I'll list the behavior I expected and the behavior I received on the things I checked out.

1) On the dashboard, click the link for the space
expected: go to the homepage for the imported space
actual: "the page you are looking for doesn't exist, etc etc"

2) Manually enter the URL for the TextFormattingRules page
expected: you get the page
actual: you get the page - so its partially working at least

3) Click the "Browse Space" link on the "Info" page of the TextFormattingRules page
expected: you go to the space browsing page, with a "Site Admin" link
actual: you get a blank page and this in the logs:
"2005-10-27 19:03:42,404 WARN [com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation] No result defined for action com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.ListPagesAction and result input"

4) Manually enter the URL for the edit space action for the new space
expected: You get the space edit page so you can set a homepage
actual: you get a NullPointerException in the log while doing getSpaceName in the space velocity template

5) Edit the database to update the spaces table with the contentid for the TextFormattingRules page as the homepage for the new space
expected: The space will start working
actual: same errors, even after restarting tomcat and rebuilding indices etc

At this point, I'm not sure how to proceed. We're an enterprise confluence customer (and JIRA, incidentally) so I've got the source for confluence. I've also got the source for jspwiki-exporter. I'm willing to hack around a bit to fix this, but I'd like confirmation that you guys are able to actually use the exporter to export the test space and import a functioning space using that export.

If that works, then its environmental and I'll try to eliminate/isolate differences.

If that doesn't work, then can we collaborate to get this thing working? I've got a looot of content in a JSPWikis that's stopping me from going live with Confluence.

Thanks!

fields.description:
Safari crashes frequently while browsing a confluence 2.0-RC1 site. Can't reliably reproduce this problem. It seems not to be related to the wysiwyg-very-JS-intensive editor and not to the lazy-loaded javascript bug [#CONF-4331] since it happend also after viewing a single page for several minutes and clicking a normal navigational link (breadcrump IIRC).

Problem occured under both available Safari 2.0 installations. It sometimes crashes the browser very seriously (loss of settings).
fields.summary: Safari crashes frequently while browsing site
Preview tab does not work as expected in Safari

fields.description:
After upgrading confluence from 1.4.4 to 2.0-RC1 via backup/restore the breadcrumb navigation displays the wrong parent/hierarchy, instead, as the direct parent "Home" is shown.

However, both the parent page at info-tab and the parent page at the browse space/pages/tree view are right.

i can fix this manually by changing the parent to any other page and back again to the original one. After this, the parent in the bread crumb navigation will be right.

Screenshot attached that shows the wrong breadcrumb navigation with the correct parent info at the info pane.

* Edit content (I was using WYSIWYG mode)
* Preview it
* Click save
* No changes are saved (or a blank new page is created if creating not editing)

fields.description:
When exporting a page to PDF, it fails if the given pageid is over 999. The result is a HTTP error 403 (Access to the specified resource () has been forbidden.)

The reason (as I see it) is that confluence formats the pageid number incorrectly, inserting a NBSP (0xA0) character as a thousand separator. For example pageid=1200:

https://xyz.comi/confluence/download/temp/export_10272005_132020/LINUX-1%A0200-20051027-13_20_20.pdf

For pages with pageid < 1000, this does not occur and they work just fine.

This is probably due to Linux/Java locale settings, but Confluence should not use these in a context like this.
fields.summary: PDF export fails on pageid > 999

fields.description:
When a table contains a list which indents, there does not appear to be a way of ending the list and continuing with text that is NOT indented.  As an example:

|Can I use MQToolsDummyProc to access the MQ manager|Yes, using the following method
* Log on to the star MQ server blahblah
* Double-click D:\Apps\RunConnectToMQ.CMD
* Connect to MQ manager BLAHBLAH
Just another bit of text|

We have also tried using combinations of:

* Connect to MQ manager BLAHBLAH\\
\\Just another bit of text|
\\

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of September 9,  2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
All,
Thanks for your patience with this issue. Over the last few months the Confluence team has been working hard and investing a significant amount of resources on making the editing experience more reliable. This, unfortunately, isn't an easy problem to solve given the nature of WYSIWYG editing in the web. 
For this specific issue, we have made good progress on it and should have it resolved with the new Confluence 4.0 editor. This new editor is not due out for a while and our current estimates have it due around the first half of 2011.
If you are interested in participating in early feedback you can join the Confluence User Taskforce by  [signing up here|http://atlassian.com/taskforce]. 

We will post updates to this issue as they happen. 
{panel}
fields.summary: When indents used in a table (eg list items) there appears to be no way to stop indenting further text

My company use an Exchange mail server with possibility to fetch mail via IMAP, but not POP3. It would be a lot easier to market the Mail archive functionality if it would work with Exchange or IMAP and not only POP3.

Regards Robert

fields.description:
Hi, 
Using the standalone Confluence distribution (also tested with Orion 2.0.5), IE crashes when switching between Rich text editing and Wiki editing. The crashes seem to be random. A combination of swtiching between editors, updating content and saving usually results in a crash. 

I assume some dhtml or javascript is crashing the browser. The current instability would make it impossible for us to use. 
Regards, 
Donal

fields.description:
User complained about a lost page - could not find it using search.  Found it with a database query to track down location and eventually found it as a live page.  I was able to reproduce the problem by following the scenario:

1) Create a new page with some unique text that can be searched for
2) restrict permission to "myself" for both view and edit
3) save
4) Run a search and verify the document can be found (might have to wait a few minutes for the indexer to run)
5) edit the same page and just change the permissions to allow anyone to view and edit
6) Run the same search (after a wait for the indexer) - page can not be found

Editing and updating the page will bring the page back into the index.
There were no errors in the catalina log.
fields.summary: Search does not find a page

fields.description:
* Attach an image, foo.jpg,  to a page
 * Edit the page to display the image !foo.jpg!
 * Create a comment and display the image inline !foo.jpg!

Image in comment will be broken

page body - http://localhost:8080/download/attachments/3178/foo..jpg
image displays fine

page comment - http://localhost:8080/download/attachments/3232/foo.jpg
image is broken

putting !http://localhost:8080/download/attachments/3178/foo..jpg! into a comment will display the image
fields.summary: image tag broken for attached images in page comments

fields.description:
We have a space that is configured so that everyone can view pages, but only members of a group can edit pages.

We want some of those pages to be editable by everyone within the confluence-users group.  This does not appear to be possible.

I have tried editing the page and setting the restrict-edit-to to "confluence-users", but those permissions do not seem to apply - when I log in with an id that is only in the confluence-users group, that id cannot edit that page.
fields.summary: Cannot allow all users to edit a page within a space restricted to a group

The search code is as follows:

XmlRpcClient rpcClient = new XmlRpcClient("http://confluence.atlassian.com/rpc/xmlrpc");
List xmlrpcResults = (List) rpcClient.execute("confluence1.search", makeParams("stuff", 100));

...

private Vector makeParams(String query, int maxResults)
    {
        Vector params = new Vector();
        params.add(""); // no authentication token
        params.add(query); // the query itself
       
        params.add(new Integer(maxResults)); // maximum # of results

        return params;
    }


Probably best to run from JIRA dev kti to reproduce.

fields.summary: NPE Permission Check Dispatcher

fields.description:
From Dan Hardiker in email:

I think it would be a good idea to hold within each plugin descriptor a list of confluence build numbers which are known to work, and are known not to work. This way upon install the plugin could be disabled by default, and upon enabling it could warn the user that this is either known not to work or is untested with this version. No warning would be shown if it is known to work, and the plugin's enabled state would default to how it does now.
fields.summary: Allow granular version checking when loading plugins
